title: QR Code Payment Trap
context: You're selling your old iPhone on Facebook Marketplace. A buyer contacts you saying they're very interested and can meet today.

steps.text: Perfect! I'll take it for full price. I'm busy at work but can meet at lunch. I'll pay via mobile banking - just need you to scan this QR code to confirm the payment went through.
They show up with official-looking banking documents and a QR code, saying you need to scan it to 'confirm receipt' of their payment. What do you do?

choices.text: Scan the QR code to confirm payment
Check your bank account first before scanning anything

steps.text: QR code scam! That code likely links to a payment request, meaning YOU would pay THEM instead of receiving money. They use fake urgency and official-looking props to seem legitimate.
steps.explanation: Always verify payments in your own account before handing over items. QR codes can be used to reverse who pays whom.

items.question: When selling items online, when should you hand over the item?

options.text: After confirming payment in your own account

items.question: What can QR codes potentially do in payment scams?
